data.title: Great Steaks and Australian Lamb Racks
data.text: Very nice dinning. Steak was cook to my liking and hubby enjoyed his lrack of lamb. Would recommend eating here. Not cheap but worth every cent.

data.title: Worst service by EDMA
data.text: Boss birthday.  Just because we were a table of 5 that ordered burgers instead of  the pricey steaks our waitress tuned us out and turned us off . Shame on you EDMA !

data.title: Surprisingly Bad Service
data.text: Hate to say this about my favorite American Steakhouse, but the service in the Brickell restaurant was awful, surprisingly so. Ever since Morton's has been bought, I've been paying attention to the food quality and service. This is the first time I've seen a lapse. Food was still up to excellent standards. Service need a lot of work.

data.title: Good Service
data.text: The Food was great, our Busser was so warm and friendly-Made the experience even better. Kenyan is a keeper.

data.title: Always Great!
data.text: Nice setting in downtown Miami.  Same great food as always.  Great service.  We went on international cabernet day.  (Who knew?)  Got $100 off a wine I can't afford!!!  Great night out at Morton's.

data.title: Great for dessert!
data.text:
My husband and I went for dessert! We walked from the Conrad Hotel, a 30 second walk. He ordered the chocolate cake, he said it was very rich but good! I ordered the cheesecake. It was outstanding! I love that it had a "crime brûlée" like touch on top of the cheesecake. The portion was a bit big but according to price. The server was polite but you could tell she didn't want to be there. We sat in the lounge. There was an extremely loud table there. We're bourbon lovers but the server just had no knowledge of bourbon nor no interest in perhaps asking a manager to stop by our table to see what we wanted. 
Great dessert though.

data.title: Great place
data.text: If you're looking for a nice dinner and atmosphere after traveling all day this is a good place.  My family enjoyed the food and the good service.  A bit on the pricey side and if you have small children this is on the formal side.  Loved it.

data.title: Unexpected Bad Service from Mortons - Unacceptable!
data.text: We went to Morton's on Saturday, August 13, 2016 and we're excited as always since it's our favorite restaurant. We have been to Morton's from San Francisco to San Juan and have always enjoyed it. What's happened to the Morton's in Miami on Brickell? First of all, the waiter didn't really have time to take our order properly (seemed to be running from table to table). He didn't ask us if we wanted anything from the bar, my husband had to get the manager to have him bring us a drink from the bar. The assistant waiter brought us some cold bread with butter, but no onion jam (told us they were running low, however, I watched him bring to the table before us and all tables after us. So what was that? A crock of BS.) I had a mixed grill plate with salmon, grilled shrimp and shrimp Alexander. My husband had a Cajun rib-eye steak that was barely seasoned, spinach with mushroom and macaroni-and-cheese. The spinach was bitter and the macaroni-and-cheese was burnt on the bottom. Normally we take our leftovers with us and savor them the next day. Not this time. We just left them there. It would be my recommendation that the management take a look at what's going on at the Morton's vs the other Morton's across the country. They are severely lacking management that's become Morton's. We won't be back to the Morton's in Miami.

data.title: Beware of check scam!
data.text: This place is an absolute joke. While I will give the restaurant credit that the food tasted great - they know NOTHING about customer service. I dined with two other girlfriends for Miami Spice and we were given subpar service from the very beginning by Mariana. Needless to say, we tipped accordingly and we EACH found on our credit card statements that she had gone and changed the tip amount to give herself more money. Upon calling to complain to the restaurant, Omar and Ramon both decided to defend her, call it a mistake (although she's been there for MULTIPLE years), and say "she wouldn't do that for a couple dollars." Let's hope we aren't the only ones this is happening to.

data.title: Very good steaks!
data.text: We were staying at JW Marriot and were hungry for...steaks. So we found Morton's just across the street. We came early being first guest. Service was very good. Steaks were pricy but vary big and tasty. We couldn't complain!

data.title: Excellent meal and service
data.text: No real complaints here.  We had great service as we were a bit early and the place was not busy at that point.  Picked a nice Charles Strong Pinot noir to go with a rib eye and a filet. Both cooked correctly as ordered.  No complaints. We had a few sides and it was a good dinner.  Some expression to finish out and we were quite satisfied.

data.title: Disappointed
data.text: My husband and I have been long time guests at Mortons, and I, a former 5 year employee in a different location. We dined in Miami location a few days ago and our experience was unpleasant. No one greeted us as we entered the restaurant, so we had a seat at the bar. The bartender was spot on with my beverage, but gave my husband the wrong drink. She was busy making drinks for the service area and offered no friendly conversation. We helped ourselves to the host area, where the manager stood, back towards us, on his cell phone. He showed us to our table and we didn't see him the rest of our stay. The food was cooked perfectly, and was as delicious as ever. The service was very poor. Our server wasn't seen to many times throughout our dinner and she had other servers helping her out. There were only about 5 other tables in the dining area. The atmosphere was so unlike the steakhouse atmosphere it used to be and it was disheartening. Sad to see that things have changed for the worse.

data.title: Is the chef trying to Cover up Bad Technique or Trying to get me Drunk
data.text: We were going to go to Smith and Wollensky's but Morton's was across the street so we went there. Even had Centurion (Black Card Concierge) make the reservation. The cocktail should of had a touch more sweet to it, but that was okay, but the Grand Marnier Soufflé was half liquid inside because the chef had such a heavy hand with the Grand Marnier. Remember this is a dessert, not a way to get drunk if you aren't already by the end of the meal. Even pouring out the liquid could not get rid of the bitter taste and the waitress when told, TOLD NO ONE. I think she was afraid they might take it off the check and her tip go down. SO I gave less tip. Bad chef, bad waitress and a manager who doesn't know his chef can't cook well. Not sure how long this Morton's will be around.

data.title: Best Fish I've possibly ever had
data.text: Loved the olive crusted Halibut!! Perfectly cooked. Steak was also picture perfect. Great drink selection. Dependable and amazing.

data.title: Everything I was hoping for
data.text:
My wife and I chose this restaurant due to its close proximity to the Conrad Hilton.

On a Sunday night only 3 or 4 tables occupied, no ambiance but good service! As an infrequent visitor to the US my passion is to to have a good rib eye. I was not disappointed, large succulent and tender.Pity about the fries.

Good choice of wines if pricey, but we enjoyed a very pleasant evening, not gourmet eating but well cooked basics

data.title: Of one the best steakhouses in Miami, Florida
data.text:
This time I was not there for the steaks. This time forced to a white meat diet and having fish and lobster on my menu the days before, I decided to have one of my favorite: The Jumbo Lump Crab Cake! You can order them as an appetizer as well.
So delicious and healthy!. Instead of pairing it with a champagne or cava, I sticked to a nice Sugar Reef, Sauvignon Blanc, Marlborough, 2014.
Try it next time when you're there!
Bon apetit!!

data.title: Traditional steakhouse
data.text: The crabcakes were memorable and amongst the best I ever had. Surprisingly, I found the meat overpriced for it was just a good steak but nothing demanding to pay top dollars. Service was excellent and ambiance was very businesslike and traditional.

data.title: Good steak
data.text: Good steak and good wine selection. This steak house is a very good option if you are looking for a good steak. Recommended!!

data.title: Nice service and average steak
data.text: Only the second Morton's and the one in Boston was better quality.  I would recommend storing the beef better so the end product tastes fresher and has  more flavor. The service was very nice and the wines are as well and good variety of menu.  Some items could have been warmer.

data.title: Average
data.text: The steak was decent, but everything else we had was pretty basic: shrimp, scallops, crab cake for appetizers and chocolate lava cake for dessert.
